Please save the context after initiating the Photo instances. Now, the rows of the Photo table appear on the database only after deleting a photo.

To see the contents of the database you can use the following useful applications:
* http://sqlitebrowser.org/
* https://github.com/dsmelov/simsim

The maximum number of pages that Flickr can return may be more or less than 40, depending on the ```per_page``` parameter.

If the ```per_page ``` parameter is set, the maximum number of usable pages from Flickr is:
```
max = 4000/per_page
```
(The default ``` per_page ``` value is 250)

So, if the ``` per_page ``` value is set to 20 the maximum number of pages is 200. The total number of pages Flickr returns ( ``` pages ``` ) can be a lot more than that, especially in densely populated areas

The app crashes here with Core Data multithreading assertions enabled. That means that the app is not "thread safe".

You can see this if you enable [Core data concurrency debugging](http://oleb.net/blog/2014/06/core-data-concurrency-debugging/).
To enable it:
* Product -> Scheme ->**Edit Scheme**
* In arguments, arguments passed on launch add a new line (press +) with this ``` -com.apple.CoreData.ConcurrencyDebug 1 ``` 

When I run the project with concurrency debugging your app crashes right after I put a pin on the map:

The problem is that there's a (Core) data access in a thread different than that of context's thread (``` .mainQueueConcurrencyType ```), and this causes occasional errors. To fix this you can either use ``` DispatchQueue.main.async ``` , ``` perform ``` or ``` performAndWait(block: () -> Void() -> Void) ```.

Check also the [course](https://www.udacity.com/course/grand-central-dispatch-gcd--ud576) about the "Grand Central Dispatch".
Please use more photos in the photo album. A good number would be between 20-30 but try to display at least 10-12.
